text: Sir Michael Francis Atiyah (; 22 April 1929 - 11 January 2019) was an English mathematician specialising in geometry. He won the Fields Medal in 1966 and the Abel Prize in 2004. He was president of the Royal Society (1990–1995), master of Trinity College, Cambridge (1990–1997), chancellor of the University of Leicester (1995–2005), and president of the Royal Society of Edinburgh (2005–2008). From 1997 until his death, he was an honorary professor at the University of Edinburgh. During 2018 International Congress of Mathematicians, Atiyah said he had a proof for Riemann hypothesis. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1988. Atiyah died on 11 January 2019 in Edinburgh, Scotland at the age of 89.A tribute to former President of the Royal Society Sir Michael Atiyah OM FRS (1929 - 2019) ==References== ==Other websites== *Michael Atiyah tells his life story at Web of Stories *The celebrations of Michael Atiyah's 80th birthday in Edinburgh, 20-24 April 2009 *Mathematical descendants of Michael Atiyah Category:Abel Prize winners Category:Fields Medalists Category:1929 births Category:2019 deaths Category:English mathematicians Category:Scientists from London Category:British geometers Category:Academics of the University of Edinburgh Category:University of Leicester Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Michael Atiyah
